prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: People's Bank Building, Harrisonburg, Va., Blueprints, Accession #10636, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was a gift to the Library on February 6, 1987, from Mr. Don Krueger, county engineer of Rockingham County, Harrisonburg, Virginia, through Martha Caldwell, James Madison University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of thirty blueprints, 1916 & 1949, of the People's Bank Building in Harrisonburg, Virginia (now the Rockingham County Office Building). The bank was designed by architect Alfred C. Bossom. The blueprints chiefly illustrate full scale details of interior and exterior views of the bank and its structural plans as well as alterations and plans for the entrance vestibule and lobby, cellar plans, the directors' room, a marble drinking fountain, and various grille work in addition to other details.

Also present are blueprints by W. H. Tuttle for 1949 renovations of the building. Tuttle's blueprints include plans for improved banking quarters and consists of various elevation schemes and perspectives.

did.unittitle: Full scale details of plaster pilaster caps, soffits, cornice ceiling, and other interior details: 1 plan, 2 interior elevations, 1 section, 4 interior details
Full scale detail of panel and clock over door: 1 interior elevation
Reflected plan of ceiling, director's room: 1 plan, 1 section
Full scale detail of marble and plaster pediment door at vault: 1 interior elevation
Full scale detail of marble and plaster main entrance to bank: 1 interior elevation
Full scale detail of marble trim around door from bank into entrance vestibule: 2 interior elevations, 1 section
Full scale detail of marble drinking fountain: 1 half plan, 2 sections
Full scale detail of show window on East Market Street: 1 plan, 1 interior elevation, 3 sections on 4'*6 sheet
Individual floor plans for the first floor, mezzanine, first floor and mezzanine revised, second floor, and third to fifth floor: 6 structural plans
Details of directors' room, various furniture details: 1 plan, 1 section
Two sheets 1/2" scale detail plan of banking room and 1/2" scale detail plan of mezzanine and reflected plan showing banking room: 3 plans

1/2" scale details of bank, screen, check desk, etc., including slightly revised sheets; 1/2" scale elevations of bank interior (2 prints, each torn, of same master sheet): 12 interior elevations, 4 sheets
Entrance vestibule and lobby details: 1 plan, 2 interior elevations, 1 section
Excavation and cellar plans: 1 plan, 1 structural plan
Alterations and additions to main entrance: 1 plan, 1 exterior elevation
Roof and penthouse plans, men's toilet details: 2 plans, 2 interior elevations, 1 section
Revised scheme done in 1949 by W. H. Tuttle-includes 2 blueprints: 4 plans, 1 exterior elevation, 1 interior elevation, 6 sections
Four different schemes for revised banking quarters: 4 plans, 1 interior elevation, 1 section, 1 perspective
More revised schemes by Tuttle: 2 plans, 5 interior elevations, 4 sections
